text: You could run that on GPU in DynamicGrids.jl in only a few lines of code. But it will be faster on threaded CPUs using `SparseOpt()`.

text: Yeah I looked into DynamicGrids but this model is on a contact network whereas it seems that dynamicgrids supports only grids. And the actual model I want to implement  will be on a time dependent network.

elements.text: Yeah I looked into DynamicGrids but this model is on a contact network whereas it seems that dynamicgrids supports only grids. And the actual model I want to implement  will be on a time dependent network.

text: I will look through the dynamicgrids code for inspiration though!

elements.text: I will look through the dynamicgrids code for inspiration though!

text: Yeah it's a limited approach in some ways, but grid-only/fixed timestep limitation was a tradeoff we chose because of the performance issues mentioned above - immutability and no allocation is easy with grids, so GPUs are easy too. And please do look through! Most of the fun is in `maprules.jl` and `cuda.jl`. I counted 19 `@generated` function the other day :joy:
